goldMentions.fixSpanMessage: Hun Sen is a named entity, please select the full span and press the F key before assigning the current mention.
goldMentions.defaultErrorMessage: Titles (''Prime Minister'') don't corefer with their described entity (''Hun Sen''), it should be a new cluster.
goldMentions.validMessage: Correct Assignment! Titles do not corefer with their titled entities.

clusterErrorMessages.6-6: Not quite! There is a difference between the ''talks'' and the fact they ''take place'', they shouldn't be in the same cluster.

goldMentions.fixSpanMessage: Multiword expressions are represented by their head mention, in this case it's the word ''take''.
goldMentions.defaultErrorMessage: That's not quite right! This should be a new cluster
Multiword expressions (e.g take place, take over, open fire) are represented by their head mention, all other words should be ignored, so ''place'' needs to be in its own cluster.
goldMentions.validMessage: Correct! Remember that multiword expressions are represented only by their head word. In this case, the head of the multi word expression ''take place'' is take.

goldMentions.validMessage: Correct! Note: Ranariddh does not corefer with leaders because Ranariddh is only one of the leaders.

goldMentions.validMessage: Correct! Note: Sam Rainsy does not corefer with leaders because he is only one of the leaders.

goldMentions.defaultErrorMessage: Hint: this word refers to the country which was already mentioned in the sentence.
goldMentions.validMessage: Correct! ''home'' here refers to the country Cambodia and not to their living house.

goldMentions.defaultErrorMessage: Not quite! This was not mentioned in the text so far

clusterErrorMessages.13-13: Not quite! The leaders do not want to be abroad, they want something to happen abroad, which word do they refer to ?
clusterErrorMessages.24-24: Not quite! This is not a new cluster, the actual object was already mentioned in the text.

clusterErrorMessages.2-3: Not quite ! Even though Hun Sen is Cambodian, here Cambodian does not refer directly to Hun Sen, rather it describes him.

goldMentions.defaultErrorMessage: Cambodian is equivalent to ''of Cambodia'' and the country was already mentioned in the previous document.
goldMentions.validMessage: Correct! Cambodian is equivalent to 'of Cambodia' and therefore belongs in the Cambodia cluster.

clusterErrorMessages.2-3: Remember titles don't corefer with their described entity.
clusterErrorMessages.0-1: Be careful! Titles do not refer to each other because different people can share the same title.

goldMentions.defaultErrorMessage: Titles do not corefer with any other mentions.
goldMentions.validMessage: Correct! That was tricky, title do not refer nor to their described entity not to other occurrences of the title.

goldMentions.defaultErrorMessage: There is already a cluster for this person, can you find it?
Remember that two mentions may corefer (refer to the same thing) even though they have different meanings. In this case, take a look at the ''insisted'' cluster.
goldMentions.validMessage: Correct! That was a very difficult assignment! Even though ''rejects'' and ''insisted'' seem different, they both mean the fact that Hun Sen wanted to maintain these talks in Cambodia and not abroad.

clusterErrorMessages.33-33: Not quite! Their demands were already mentioned in the first document..

goldMentions.defaultErrorMessage: Not quite! Their demands can be expressed using different form, look at the end of the first document.
goldMentions.validMessage: This was a very tricky decision. The same wish of Ranaridh and Rainsy to make the talks abroad is expressed in the two documents using different form and words (''wanted'' and ''demands''), but they do refer to the same thing.

goldMentions.defaultErrorMessage: Are you sure this mention belongs there?

clusterErrorMessages.12-12: Not quite! The parties constitute the opposition but they do not refer to the opposition.
clusterErrorMessages.13-13: Be careful, the leaders are some individual persons while the parties are a group of politicians.

goldMentions.defaultErrorMessage: Not quite! Maybe it's the first time the parties are written in the documents ...
goldMentions.validMessage: Correct! Note that ''opposition'' and ''parties'' do not refer to the same entity and therefore do not corefer.
